cChar

A class for one character object. It may be only a vowel, a vowel-consonant combination, or any other character

Functions
cChar

Creates a new character object.

Parameter

mainChar - mainCharCode -

Variables
mainChar
this.mainChar
mainCharCode
this.mainCharCode
vowelChar
this.vowelChar
vowelNumber
this.vowelNumber
index
this.index
maatraa
this.maatraa
systemMaatraa
this.systemMaatraa

Maatraa calculated by system. Maybe diff from maatraa if user adjusts it

maatraaCumulative
this.maatraaCumulative
maapneeType
this.maapneeType

Does this character have to be colored as per 2 or 1 when displaying maapnee analysis? Normally will be 2 or 1 as per the character's maatraa but if there are 2 consecutive 1s and they match with a 2 in the maapnee pattern then maapneeType = 1.5 even when maatraa = 1 -- indicating like 2, but 1+1 2.

maapneeIndex
this.maapneeIndex
isRadeef
this.isRadeef
isKaafiyaa
this.isKaafiyaa
isHindi
this.isHindi
rhymeLevel
this.rhymeLevel

0 = no rhyme, 1 = vowel rhyme, 2 = full rhyme

rhymeGroup
this.rhymeGroup
Functions
replaceMainChar
replaceMainChar(
newMainChar
)

When a consonant has a Nuqta or dot below like ड़, it is handled as one character in this s/w but the dot below is a separate character in Unicode. So the dot has to be merged with the existing character.

Parameter

newMainChar

Setter vowel

Set the vowel character for this character block

isHalfLetter
isHalfLetter()

Determine if character is half letter

Returns

True or False

isPureVowel
isPureVowel()

Determine whether character is a pure vowel with no consonant

Returns

True or False

isLaghu
isLaghu ()

Checks if this character is of laghu vowel

Returns

True or False

isDeergha
isDeergha()

Checks if this character is of deergha vowel

Returns

True or False

calculateHalfLetterLen
calculateHalfLetterLen(
p = false,
n = false
)
Determine when a half letter will have 0 or 1 maatraa. The logic for default handling

which the user can always override.

Parameters
p

previous letter

n

next letter

adjustCharMaatraa
adjustCharMaatraa()

When the user adjusts the maatraa by clicking on the char, then adjust the maatraa

get text
get text()

Getter. Return full text of a character, i.e. mainchar + vowelchar

get joinedConsonantVowel
get joinedConsonantVowel()

Getter. Gets the mainchar+vowelchar. This is different from get text in that it returns all chars, even non-hindi ones.

compare
compare(
cin
)

Compares this character with a given cChar object.

Return

  • "all" for full match

  • true when vowel is the same

  • false when vowel is not the same (so consonant matching is irrelevant)
